definition: plaited matting (of rushes, bamboo etc)/silkworm basket/metal foil/foil paper

sentences.english: "Where do you put the tinfoil?" a man asks.
sentences.chinese: “您把錫箔裹在哪裏？”一個男士問。

sentences.english: She wrapped the roast chicken up in foil.
sentences.chinese: 她用錫箔紙將烤雞包起來了。

sentences.english: Tear the tinfoil paper cigarette box lined with 20 cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 撕錫箔紙菸盒內整齊的排列着20根香菸。

sentences.english: You can wrap it up in tinfoil.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用錫箔紙裹住它。

sentences.english: They were fragile and prone to tearing, and the messages recorded on them soon wore out.
sentences.chinese: 錫箔又薄又脆容易撕裂，錄在上面的信息會很快磨損。

sentences.english: Lead poisoning sickens 600 in East China.
sentences.chinese: 浙江一錫箔作坊600人鉛中毒。

sentences.english: Would you like my tin-foil hat?
Cover cake pan with foil and let stand at room temperature.
sentences.chinese: 將蛋糕連盤覆蓋錫箔，置於室溫中。

sentences.english: Attached to the balloon is some tin foil, which will provide a spark.
sentences.chinese: 與氣球相接的是一些錫箔，它們會產生火花。

sentences.english: Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line a baking tray with non-stick tin foil.
sentences.chinese: 烤箱預熱至325度，烤盤撲上一層錫箔紙。

definition: horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
the spongy, white pulp inside the stem of rush plants, used as a wick for oil lamps
altar lamp burning day and night
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
